data.title: Campus of the Future in a Building of the Past
data.text:
Abstract

After a fire that completely destroyed TU Delft’s Faculty of Architecture building on May 13 2008, a team of academics, architects and other professionals worked with impossible deadlines to refurbish a huge cultural heritage building (> 30,000 m2) – which was selected from five alternatives to become BK City – within six months for 3,300 students and more than 800 employees. This chapter describes (1) the process and leadership decisions, (2) innovative concepts, and (3) lessons from this project.
